Specific Details: Many charities operate in an environment where they are contracted to the state to deliver services on a commissioning/competitive tendering basis.  As a sector, we are increasingly getting feedback from charities that this cost-driven model is unsustainable.  Research indicates that price-driven services can result in poorer quality or less service for service users.  Typically, many contracts exclude essential “overhead” costs such as governance and the need to engage professional employees.
DPOs Lobbied: Dara Calleary|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Neasa Hourigan|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: Many charities operate in an environment where they are contracted to the state to deliver services on a commissioning/competitive tendering basis.  As a sector, we are increasingly getting feedback from charities that this cost-driven model is unsustainable.  Research indicates that price-driven services can result in poorer quality or less service for service users.  Typically, many contracts exclude essential “overhead” costs such as governance and the need to engage professional employees.
Intended Results: Our ask of you is that you seek to have the Action Plan envisaged by DCRD accelerated (ideally in the first 100 days) so that a new model for engaging with charities is developed which assures service users of the best service while not threatening the sustainability of charities. The sector is keen to be part of the solution as we face a challenging future.

We surveyed our members to gauge their feelings on the upcoming Budget and their concerns were;
1.	Retain 9% VAT rate 
2.	Rates freeze or support for businesses. 
3.	Continued energy support for businesses
Businesses are fearful of a tough Winter and for some businesses with debt warehousing due to be repaid next year cashflow is at an all-time low. With increase in the minimum wage in 2024 and increase of Statutory Sick Pay to 5 days, outlook for 2024 is tough before it even starts.::Budget 2024 represents an opportunity to further develop recent Government momentum and initiatives, and protect and develop the small, medium and large Irish private enterprises that are the cornerstone of our successful Irish economy.
